intro: Carlina corymbosa f. vestita, commonly known as the white-rayed cudweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun. Its foliage is covered in dense, white hairs, giving it a distinctive silvery appearance. The inflorescence consists of yellow disk flowers surrounded by white ray florets, making it visually striking in its natural environment.
